When’s the best time to get the new COVID booster shot? Here’s what experts say

The CDC recommends anyone 12 and older get a booster at least two months after their last shot or three months after recovering from a COVID infection. But some studies and experts are coalescing around the belief that waiting longer — roughly three to six months — may be more optimal in order to get the biggest benefit from the additional booster.
